TopicTitle: Take a look out the VAB door in .22

Articles.Content:
What do you see? It's the .21 launchpad with the round instead of hexagonal surround and without the additions to the sides of the ramp.

Kreedence Klearwater Revival
They didn't notice that, and neither did I! Shame on me and SQUAD!
The VAB door is obviously a portal to another dimension where clouds exists. So no telling what else you'll see out there

The VAB door is obviously a portal to another dimension where clouds exists. So no telling what else you'll see out there

It's also always daylight in that dimension. Oh, and for some reason there's a force that rotates your rockets 90 degrees from their orientation in the VAB to the launchpad. I didn't notice that until I built my first rover, nicely aligned so it could roll out the door to the pad but it appeared on the pad sideways.

It's also always daylight in that dimension.

I remember a thread with a huge discussion between people who know about 3D and people who really know about 3D about how supposedly easy a fix that were ...

Oh, and for some reason there's a force that rotates your rockets 90 degrees from their orientation in the VAB to the launchpad.

I hate respectfully dislike that, too!
The always-daytime thing doesn't bother me so much in that the 'design phase' of your rocket [i always presumed] falls outside of normal flight time, and employees don't work night shift.
